pullrequest.title: Allow world with a name other than "default". Fixed all tests.

content.raw:
Things are looking good. I did have one minor logic fix to the code I added to gz_build_test.bash, but it's not major.
~~~
diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done
~~~
content.html:
Things are looking good. I did have one minor logic fix to the code I added to gz_build_test.bash, but it's not major.

diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done

Probably it will need manual inspection in the affected machines.

content.raw:
I've fixed the compilation problem for the new viewers subdirectory and paths to QTestFixture in commit 264110b and spin new compilations runs.

In our OSRF Nvidia machine all seems to be fixed.

In the Amazon instance some errors have appeared: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-vrc/16/testReport/:

* Segfaults for stress factory and transport
* Timeout in ServerFixture for Bullet related tests: ContactSensor and LaserTest

In our OSRF Nvidia machine all seems to be fixed.

In the Amazon instance some errors have appeared: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-vrc/16/testReport/:

  • Segfaults for stress factory and transport
  • Timeout in ServerFixture for Bullet related tests: ContactSensor and LaserTest

pullrequest.title: Allow world with a name other than "default". Fixed all tests.

content.raw:
Out of a linux machine at this moment to confirm it but my hypothesis would be that the "/" in the test name is breaking the -o logging since it makes linux to think it is a subdirectory/case.xml (instead of a full filename) and the subdirectory "viewers" does not exist under test_results so it is impossible to log the file there. This explains also the lack of failing in the jenkins results since the XML with fails was never written.

Sound reasonable? Could we have the test name changed to not use a slash?
content.html:
Out of a linux machine at this moment to confirm it but my hypothesis would be that the "/" in the test name is breaking the -o logging since it makes linux to think it is a subdirectory/case.xml (instead of a full filename) and the subdirectory "viewers" does not exist under test_results so it is impossible to log the file there. This explains also the lack of failing in the jenkins results since the XML with fails was never written.

Sound reasonable? Could we have the test name changed to not use a slash?

content.html:
At this moment I think all current failing tests on Nvidia (both precise/quantal) are fixed are have a patch that could fix them.

For ATI we have a couple more failing (in the last two runs). For the first one it could hide a race condition problems if our ATI is the slowest machine/GPU around. The second one is related to render.

SensorManager_TEST.InitRemove:

/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-ati/gazebo/gazebo/sensors/SensorManager_TEST.cc:118
Expected: (i) < (20), actual: 30 vs 20

related code:

  // Try removing a few senors.
  for (sensors::Sensor_V::iterator iter = sensors.begin();
       iter != sensors.end() && sensorCount > 10; ++iter)
  {
    mgr->RemoveSensor((*iter)->GetName());

    --sensorCount;

    int i = 0;

    // Wait for a sensor manager update.
    while (mgr->GetSensors().size() > sensorCount)
    {
      gazebo::common::Time::MSleep(100);
      ++i;
    }

    EXPECT_LT(i, 20);
  }

HeightmapTest.Heights :

/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-ati/gazebo/test/regression/heightmap.cc:119
Value of: math::equal(physicsTest.back(), renderTest.back(), 0.13f)
  Actual: false
Expected: true

related code:

      // Test to see if the physics height is equal to the render engine
      // height.
      EXPECT_TRUE(math::equal(physicsTest.back(), renderTest.back(), 0.13f));

content.raw:
I just noticed a small mistake in my logic for that script. As written it will include the wrong console out if test_ran fails. Here's a fix:
~~~
diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash	Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash	Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done
 
~~~
content.html:
I just noticed a small mistake in my logic for that script. As written it will include the wrong console out if test_ran fails. Here's a fix:

diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done

content.html:
In the latest two runs of GPU Amazon machine I've seen some ODE test cases failing in different tests suites.

In run #9: ContactSensor.StackTestODE, ImuTest.EmptyWorldBiasODE and LaserTest.LaserBoxODE.

In run #10 only LaserTest.LaserBoxODE.

All errors ( Expected i < 50) are in the same line of ServerFixture.hh 559 which seems like it could be a timeout problem:

               // Wait for the entity to spawn
               while (!this->HasEntity(_modelName) && i < 50)
               {
                 common::Time::MSleep(20);
                 ++i;
               }
               EXPECT_LT(i, 50);
             }

content.raw:
The first error in your output for the pioneer2dx test indicates that the pioneer2dx model doesn't exist on your computer. This could be caused by incorrect environment variables, lack of internet connection to download pioneer2dx, or gazebosim.org was down.

Can you include a backtrace for the second error?
content.html:
The first error in your output for the pioneer2dx test indicates that the pioneer2dx model doesn't exist on your computer. This could be caused by incorrect environment variables, lack of internet connection to download pioneer2dx, or gazebosim.org was down.

Can you include a backtrace for the second error?

content.raw:
I ran make test, and I get a consistent failure with the pioneer2dx test. Running Quantal.

This is the test output:


```
#!bash

Error [parser.cc:562] Directory doesn't exist[pioneer2dx]
Warning [parser.cc:578] The manifest.xml for a Gazebo model is deprecated. Please rename manifest.xml to model.config.
Warning [parser.cc:361] Converting a deprecated SDF source[/home/brawner/.gazebo/models/sun/model.sdf].
Set SDF value
Warning [Converter.cc:61]   Version[1.2] to Version[1.4]
  Please use the gzsdf tool to update your SDF files.
    $ gzsdf convert [sdf_file]
Msg Waiting for master
Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
Msg Publicized address: 192.168.1.89
Dbg ServerFixture load in 0.09 seconds, timeout after 60 seconds
DIst[20.0146]
EnPose.x[0]
/home/brawner/workspace/gazebo/test/regression/pioneer2dx.cc:73: Failure
Expected: (fabs(endPose.pos.x - dist)) < (0.1), actual: 20.0146 vs 0.1
```

The other one that gave me trouble, but not consistently was transport_stress. It segfaulted with the following:


```
#!bash

Warning [Publisher.cc:127] Queue limit reached for topic /gazebo/default/pose/info, deleting message. This warning is printed only once.
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::exception_detail::clone_impl<boost::exception_detail::error_info_injector<boost::lock_error> >'
  what():  boost::lock_error
Aborted (core dumped)
```

This is the first time I've really run the tests individually. If you need more helpful output, I might need some pointers. We can discuss tomorrow.
content.html:
I ran make test, and I get a consistent failure with the pioneer2dx test. Running Quantal.

This is the test output:

Error [parser.cc:562] Directory doesn't exist[pioneer2dx]
Warning [parser.cc:578] The manifest.xml for a Gazebo model is deprecated. Please rename manifest.xml to model.config.
Warning [parser.cc:361] Converting a deprecated SDF source[/home/brawner/.gazebo/models/sun/model.sdf].
Set SDF value
Warning [Converter.cc:61]   Version[1.2] to Version[1.4]
  Please use the gzsdf tool to update your SDF files.
    $ gzsdf convert [sdf_file]
Msg Waiting for master
Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
Msg Publicized address: 192.168.1.89
Dbg ServerFixture load in 0.09 seconds, timeout after 60 seconds
DIst[20.0146]
EnPose.x[0]
/home/brawner/workspace/gazebo/test/regression/pioneer2dx.cc:73: Failure
Expected: (fabs(endPose.pos.x - dist)) < (0.1), actual: 20.0146 vs 0.1

The other one that gave me trouble, but not consistently was transport_stress. It segfaulted with the following:

Warning [Publisher.cc:127] Queue limit reached for topic /gazebo/default/pose/info, deleting message. This warning is printed only once.
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::exception_detail::clone_impl<boost::exception_detail::error_info_injector<boost::lock_error> >'
  what():  boost::lock_error
Aborted (core dumped)

This is the first time I've really run the tests individually. If you need more helpful output, I might need some pointers. We can discuss tomorrow.

content.raw: I really like the gz_build_test script. Should we rename it to have a .bash suffix since it's a bash script? Also, I noticed that cppcheck wasn't redirecting all of its output to the logfile. So in 4f47f06 of branch default_worldname_scpeters, I fixed that and added a verbose logfile that includes the raw console output for all failing tests. This is helpful for debugging what went wrong.
content.html: I really like the gz_build_test script. Should we rename it to have a .bash suffix since it's a bash script? Also, I noticed that cppcheck wasn't redirecting all of its output to the logfile. So in 4f47f06 of branch default_worldname_scpeters, I fixed that and added a verbose logfile that includes the raw console output for all failing tests. This is helpful for debugging what went wrong.

content.raw:
A possible patch to get the QTest based tests to log the data in the corresponding XML file, could be something like:

```
#!diff
diff -r 237e08ff175c cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake
--- a/cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake	Tue Apr 09 16:18:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake	Thu Apr 11 03:01:11 2013 +0200
@@ -245,8 +245,8 @@
       ${QT_LIBRARIES}
       )
 
-    add_test(${BINARY_NAME} ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/${BINARY_NAME} -xml)
-
+    # QTest need and extra -o parameter to write logging information to a file
+    add_test(${BINARY_NAME} ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/${BINARY_NAME} -xml -o ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test_results/${BINARY_NAME}.xml)
     set_tests_properties(${BINARY_NAME} PROPERTIES TIMEOUT 240)
 
     # Check that the test produced a result and create a failure if it didn't.
```
content.html:
A possible patch to get the QTest based tests to log the data in the corresponding XML file, could be something like:

diff -r 237e08ff175c cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake
--- a/cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake   Tue Apr 09 16:18:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake   Thu Apr 11 03:01:11 2013 +0200
@@ -245,8 +245,8 @@
       ${QT_LIBRARIES}
       )

-    add_test(${BINARY_NAME} ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/${BINARY_NAME} -xml)
-
+    # QTest need and extra -o parameter to write logging information to a file
+    add_test(${BINARY_NAME} ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/${BINARY_NAME} -xml -o ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test_results/${BINARY_NAME}.xml)
     set_tests_properties(${BINARY_NAME} PROPERTIES TIMEOUT 240)

     # Check that the test produced a result and create a failure if it didn't.

content.raw:
Seems like the final report in xml result file is ok, since test results can not be found but the check_ tests are always returning true, so system console show them as "passed". A fix for this (working for me) could be:


```
#!diff

diff -r 237e08ff175c tools/check_test_ran.py
--- a/tools/check_test_ran.py	Tue Apr 09 16:18:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/check_test_ran.py	Thu Apr 11 02:53:29 2013 +0200
@@ -74,6 +74,7 @@
     <failure message="Unable to find test results for %(test)s, test did not run.\nExpected results in %(test_file)s" type=""/>
   </testcase>
 </testsuite>"""%d)
+        sys.exit(getattr(os, 'EX_USAGE', 1))
 
 if __name__ == '__main__':
     check_main()

```
content.html:
Seems like the final report in xml result file is ok, since test results can not be found but the check_ tests are always returning true, so system console show them as "passed". A fix for this (working for me) could be:

diff -r 237e08ff175c tools/check_test_ran.py
--- a/tools/check_test_ran.py   Tue Apr 09 16:18:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/check_test_ran.py   Thu Apr 11 02:53:29 2013 +0200
@@ -74,6 +74,7 @@
     <failure message="Unable to find test results for %(test)s, test did not run.\nExpected results in %(test_file)s" type=""/>
   </testcase>
 </testsuite>"""%d)
+        sys.exit(getattr(os, 'EX_USAGE', 1))

 if __name__ == '__main__':
     check_main()

content.raw:
In case anyone is interested, I've add `gz_build_test.sh` as a cronjob. You can add a cron job with the following:

`crontab -e`

Add the following line at the end:

`0 2 * * * <path to gz_build_test.sh> <branch names separated by spaces>`

The above line will run the script every morning at 2am.
content.html:
In case anyone is interested, I've add gz_build_test.sh as a cronjob. You can add a cron job with the following:

crontab -e

Add the following line at the end:

0 2 * * * <path to gz_build_test.sh> <branch names separated by spaces>

The above line will run the script every morning at 2am.
